page.title: 11THE CHURCH OF HIGHAM FERRERS
page.content: Since the 1300's religion in Higham Ferrers has centred around the Church of the Blessed Virgin Mary. The impressive 170ft spire can be clearly seen from miles around. The dark stone interior of the church is brightened by colourful stain glass windows and ornaments. This peaceful church provides a quiet sanctuary for prayer. Christenings,confirmations,weddings and funerals all take place at St. Mary's but the most popular service is Mass on Sunday. Many other activities take place in the church and the adjacent Bede House e.g.Brownies and Guides. The present vicar enjoys his work and feels strongly about it. He is friendly,easy to talk to and very trustworthy since he leaves the church open during daylight despite the threat of vandalism.
